de.advitec.sulfur

Class Browser

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.advitec.sulfur.Browser

  • public class Browser
extends Object
    Controls an actual browser. Elements are selected by locator expressions as described at find(java.lang.String) method.
    Author:
    Chelmbold

    • Constructor Detail

      • Browser

        public Browser()
        Creates a new Browser instance using Firefox as default.

      • Browser

        public Browser(String browserName)
        Creates a new Browser instance using FireFox or Chrome. To be able to use chrome, you have to download the ChromeDriver for your operating system, and set the environment variable 'webdriver.chrome.driver' pointing to your ChromeDriver executable.
        Parameters:
        browserName - 'firefox' or 'chrome'

        Loads the given URL. Example: | get | http://example.com |
        Parameters:
        url - URL to be opened in the browser.

        Parameters:
        value - Value to be typed in the selected element.
        element - Locator of the element to be used.

        Returns:

                                   String value)

        element - Locator of the element to be used.
        attribute - Attribute to be checked.
        value - Expected attribute value.
        Returns:

        find(java.lang.String)

        element - Locator of the element to be used.

      • selectValueIn

        public void selectValueIn(String value,
                 String element)
        Selects a select box option by key. Example: | select value | someValue | in | id:someElement |
        Parameters:
        value - Value of the value attribute of the option to be selected.
        element - Locator of the element to be used.
        See Also:
        find(java.lang.String)

      • selectPositionIn

        public void selectPositionIn(int index,
                    String element)
        Selects a select box option by position. Example: | select position | 0 | in | id:someElement |
        Parameters:
        index - Index (starting at 0) of the of the option to be selected.
        element - Locator of the element to be used.
        See Also:

      • close

        Closes the browser.

      • find

        public static org.openqa.selenium.WebElement find(String selector)
        Finds the WebElement by the given selector. This method is used internally wherever an 'element' parameter takes a selector expression. The selector type (eg. 'xpath') is separated from its value by a colon.
        Parameters:
        selector - one of the following selector types
        selectordescriptionexample selectormatches
        id id attribute id:loginButton <input type="submit" id="loginButton" />
        name name attribute name:email<input type="text" name="email" />
        tag name of tag tag:h1 <h1>Example</h1>
        link link text link:log in <a href="...">log in</a>
        linkPart part of the link text linkPart:log <a href="...">log in</a>
        class css class attribute class:auth <a href="..." class="auth" >log in</a>
        xpath expression to locate an xml element xpath://input[@alt='Search'] <input type="image" src="some.gif" alt="Search" title="Search">
        css CSS 3 selektor css:#category button <div class="category"><button class="confirmation">OK</button></div>
        Returns:
        found element
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified element is not found.
